1.annotation: Optionally specify comma-separated fields from the cell metadata for use in differential expression.

inputs.description: Optionally specify comma-separated fields from the cell metadata for use in differential expression.
inputs.name: cell_type_field

3.annotation: The cell metadata column that differentiates among experiments/batches.

inputs.description: The cell metadata column that differentiates among experiments/batches.
inputs.name: batch_variable

3.label: batch_variable
3.name: Input parameter

4.annotation: Select the representation to be used in t-SNE and neighbour graph calculation. Should usually be 'X_pca' without batches, 'X_pca_harmony' with batches.

inputs.description: Select the representation to be used in t-SNE and neighbour graph calculation. Should usually be 'X_pca' without batches, 'X_pca_harmony' with batches.
inputs.name: representation

4.label: representation
4.name: Input parameter

6.annotation: The data part of the matrix market (mtx format) set of files. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.aggregated_counts.mtx.gz

inputs.description: The data part of the matrix market (mtx format) set of files. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.aggregated_counts.mtx.gz
inputs.name: matrix

6.label: matrix
6.name: Input dataset

7.annotation: The matrix market columns file, containing the barcodes. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.aggregated_counts.mtx_cols.gz

inputs.description: The matrix market columns file, containing the barcodes. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.aggregated_counts.mtx_cols.gz
inputs.name: barcodes

7.label: barcodes
7.name: Input dataset

8.annotation: A tab-delimited text file of additional cell metadata, to be matched to the file supplied in ‘barcodes’ via the first column of both files. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.cell_metadata.tsv

inputs.description: A tab-delimited text file of additional cell metadata, to be matched to the file supplied in ‘barcodes’ via the first column of both files. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.cell_metadata.tsv
inputs.name: cellmeta

8.label: cellmeta
8.name: Input dataset

9.annotation: The matrix market row files with gene identifiers. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.aggregated_counts.mtx_rows.gz

inputs.description: The matrix market row files with gene identifiers. An example would be http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/microarray/data/atlas/sc_experiments/E-MTAB-6077/E-MTAB-6077.aggregated_counts.mtx_rows.gz
inputs.name: genes

9.label: genes
9.name: Input dataset

10.annotation: A tab-delimited text file of additional gene metadata, to be matched to the file supplied in ‘genes’ via the first column of both files. See https://github.com/ebi-gene-expression-group/scxa-workflows/blob/develop/README.md for more information on how to create this from an Ensembl GTF file

inputs.description: A tab-delimited text file of additional gene metadata, to be matched to the file supplied in ‘genes’ via the first column of both files. See https://github.com/ebi-gene-expression-group/scxa-workflows/blob/develop/README.md for more information on how to create this from an Ensembl GTF file
inputs.name: genemeta

10.label: genemeta
